title: Context-Based Learning Design and Assembly Theory Application Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Core instructional design principles and leadership experience in social domains
context.additional_context: Focused on learners in managerial/leadership roles improving learning design in real work environments; utilizing smartphone-based supplementary tools in PC-unavailable settings

learning_goals: Learners can identify three or more human/non-human factors to consider in instructional design using assemblage theory.
Learners can analyze constraints (technical, social, theoretical) and propose alternatives when developing context-based design tasks.
Learners can create instructional design plans reflecting community contexts and revise them through peer feedback.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
